alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Western Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 7:04PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west and southwest Marion County through 800 PM EDT... At 703 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm centered 8 miles south of Ocala Airport, or 11 miles southwest of Ocala, moving northwest at 5 mph. Other storms scattered storms were developing over mainly rural areas of west Marion county. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Ocala, Rainbow Lakes Estates, Sparr, Santos, Anthony, Ocala Airport, Belleview, Dunnellon, Lowell and Romeo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
